events.event_description: Inflation-adjusted fuel prices for natural gas vehicles increased in 37 states after a decade of stable prices.
events.citation: After a decade of nearly flat prices from 2011 to 2021, inflation-adjusted fuel prices for natural gas vehicles increased in 37 states from 2021 to 2023

events.event_description: Natural gas vehicle fuel market in the United States doubled from 30 billion cubic feet to more than 62 Bcf.
events.citation: Natural gas sold to the on-road vehicle fuel market in the United States more than doubled over the past decade from 30 billion cubic feet (Bcf) in 2013 to more than 62 Bcf in 2023

events.event_description: Natural gas vehicle fuel prices showed extreme variation across states, with Rhode Island having highest prices at $34.66/MMBtu and North Carolina the lowest at $5.73/MMBtu.
events.citation: In 2023, natural gas vehicle fuel prices ranged from a high of $34.66 per million British thermal units (MMBtu) in Rhode Island to a low of $5.73/MMBtu in North Carolina

events.event_description: California dominated the natural gas vehicle fuel market with 51% share, followed by Florida at 10%.
events.citation: In 2023, California accounted for 51% of the nation's market for natural gas vehicle fuel. Florida, the state with the next-largest consumption, accounted for 10%

events.event_description: North Carolina showed dramatic growth in natural gas vehicle fuel consumption, increasing from 71 million cubic feet to nearly 1.8 Bcf.
events.citation: Consumption of natural gas vehicle fuel has increased in North Carolina, which has several state laws and incentives for CNG, at a faster rate than in any other state, growing from 71 million cubic feet in 2013 to nearly 1.8 Bcf in 2023
